medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe nasal airway problems due to previous septal operation.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had experienced nasal airway problems following the complete removal of the cartilaginous septum in 1983, leading to a severe collapse of the nose.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of Behçet disease, treated with colchicine and steroids. Symptoms included oral and genital aphthous lesions, arthritis, and cutaneous lesions.
medical_history.family_history: Two sisters of the patient also had Behçet disease.
